comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Aaron Flegeltaub (the photographer), born c1844 in Suwalki Poland, was a prominent photographer who operated studios, at various times, in several cities including Ballarat, Stawell and Melbourne. He advertised a "School of Photography", was a dealer in photographic equipment and was one of the first to import and demonstrate X-ray machines. He was likely responsible for the founding of the South Australian Photographic Society in 1885. He died in 1921. [1] [2] [3]

comment.author: 64838194@N02
comment._content: Great example of 1880's style, how restrictive it was. I've noticed that women's heads were often too large for their body size...or was it their bodies that were shrunken due to corseting from a young age?
